alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 11:07AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Apache and Navajo Counties through 1145 AM MST... At 1106 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong cluster of thunderstorms 8 miles south of Vernon, or 22 miles west of Springerville, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Vernon, Little Ortega Lake, Los Burros Campground and Brown Creek Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 273 near mile marker 378. State Route 260 between mile markers 363 and 381. State Route 473 between mile markers 0 and 3. Highway 60 between mile markers 345 and 368. State Route 61 between mile markers 353 and 366. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; White Mountains
